intro: Struthanthus alveolatus, commonly known as the desert lily, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, featuring succulent stems and leaves adapted to conserve water. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and are pollinated by insects, particularly bees. Struthanthus alveolatus is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
